msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors. Six lines in the incipit page of Text I-1 (fol. 4r), in three groups, alternating with black lines; incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; six lines in the incipit page of the section “Friday morning” (Text I-8), in three groups, alternating with black lines. Titles of the Biblical books and other works; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; abbreviations in Text I-7 and Text I-8; the beginning word of each paragraph in the text “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” within Text I-9; the words yǝbe in Text I-4 (esp. fols. 17vb-18rc) and Text I-6 (esp. fols. 53vc-54ra); the words yǝtärägwǝm in Text I-6 and Text I-8, mätärgwäm in Text I-8, wä-yǝbäl/wä-yǝbälu in Text I-8, ṣällǝyu in Text I-9. Elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the text dividers.

msItem.note: The names of the individuals (donors?) mentioned in the supplication formulas seem to have been added by a red ink (vermilion) different from the other rubrications, though the hand appears the same.

In a few of the supplication formulas, the names of the individuals to whom the supplication is dedicated are missing, so the space is empty (e.g., fols. 57ra l.20, 69ra l.20, 71vb l.11, 76ra ls. 29-30, 96vc ls. 4-5, 116va l.29); in fol. 60va l.1 it is not clear whether the name has been washed out.

person.persName: Additio 2 mentiones ras Sǝbḥat (ras Sǝbḥat ʾArägawi, b. ca. 1844, d. 1914), with baptismal name Kidanä Maryam, as the donor. The names of his relatives are also mentioned: his mother Wälättä Śǝllase, his wife Wälättä Maryam, his children Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel, ʾArʾaya Śǝllase. Names of other individuals are written in some supplication formulas: Gäbrä Śǝllase (esp. fols. 6ra l.10, 136ra l.17, 150rc l.32) and Wäldä Maryam (fols. 24rb ls.9-10, 91rb l.31, 144vb ls.6-7). In two supplication formulas “people of the place” (säbʾa hagär) (esp. fol. 29vb) and as the “people of the place, children of the community” (säbʾa hagär däqiqä maḫbär) are mentioned (esp. fol. 153rc).
